intro: Oenothera hartwegii var. tubicula, commonly known as the tubular evening primrose, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Oenothera hartwegii var. tubicula is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
